Ricardo opens the browser at http://localhost:32770

rootCause.message:
After several attempts, could not instantiate new WebDriver instance of type class org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver (Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: Chrome failed to start: exited normally.
  (session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist)
  (The process started from chrome location /usr/bin/google-chrome is no longer running, so ChromeDriver is assuming that Chrome has crashed.)

Build info: version: '4.23.1', revision: '656257d8e9'
System info: os.name: 'Linux', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '6.8.0-1014-azure', java.version: '21.0.4'
Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver
Command: [null, newSession {capabilities=[Capabilities {acceptInsecureCerts: true, browserName: chrome, goog:chromeOptions: {args: [no-sandbox, incognito, disable-default-apps, disable-gpu, disable-extensions, window-size=1920,1080, no-sandbox, incognito, disable-default-apps, disable-gpu, disable-extensions, window-size=1920,1080, remote-allow-origins=*], binary: /usr/bin/google-chrome, excludeSwitches: [enable-automation, disable-popup-blocking], extensions: []}}]}]). See below for more details.

Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: Chrome failed to start: exited normally.
  (session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist)
  (The process started from chrome location /usr/bin/google-chrome is no longer running, so ChromeDriver is assuming that Chrome has crashed.)

children.description: Ricardo clicks on the Owners menu
When he selects the owner in the Owners page
Then he should see the registered information of Jean Coleman

userStory.storyName: The Pet Clinic should allow to manage the owners information
userStory.displayName: The Pet Clinic should allow to manage the owners information
userStory.narrative:
As a VetClinic Manager
  I would like to be able to manage the owners information
  In order to handle all the pets and visits made by them

rule.name: The system should allow to access the personal information of an owner

1) Could not instantiate class org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver
2) Expected: a collection with size a value greater than <2>
     but: collection size <0> was less than <2>
